doc.title: Font
doc.desc: The Font class is a class for managing fonts.

member.name: getTextWidth
member.shortdesc: Get the width of a string

argitem.name: text
argitem.desc: Specifies the string for which you want to get the width.

member.result: Returns the width of the specified string in pixels
member.desc: This method allows you to get the width required when drawing the specified string with the current font settings.

member.name: getTextHeight
member.shortdesc: Get the height of a string

argitem.name: text
argitem.desc: Specifies the string for which you want to get the height.

member.result: Returns the height of the specified string in pixels
member.desc: This method allows you to get the height required when drawing the specified string with this font.

member.name: getEscWidthX
member.shortdesc: X-coordinate movement amount in the horizontal direction of the character

argitem.name: text
argitem.desc: Specifies the string for which you want to get the X-coordinate movement amount in the horizontal direction.

member.result: Returns the X-coordinate movement amount in the horizontal direction in pixels
member.desc: You can get the movement amount of the character drawing position required when drawing the specified character with the current font settings. This method allows you to get the movement amount on the X-coordinate when moving horizontally (left) relative to the character drawing direction.

member.name: getGlyphDrawRect
member.shortdesc: Actual drawing range of the string

argitem.name: text
argitem.desc: Specifies the string for which you want to get the range.

member.result: Actual drawing range of the string
member.desc: You can get the range where the glyph image is drawn when drawing the specified character with the current font settings. The obtained range is a Rect class object based on the 0,0 coordinates. Only horizontal orientation is supported.

member.name: getList

argitem.name: flags
argitem.desc: Specifies how to enumerate fonts. Specify a combination of the following values using bitwise OR. fsfFixedPitch : Enumerates only fixed-pitch fonts fsfSameCharSet : Enumerates only fonts with the same character set fsfNoVertical : Does not enumerate vertical writing fonts fsfTrueTypeOnly : Enumerates only TrueType fonts fsfIgnoreSymbol : Excludes symbol character sets If fsfSameCharSet is specified, fonts with the same character set as the currently selected font will be enumerated.

member.result: An array where each element is a font name (string)
member.desc: Enumerates font names and returns them as an array.

member.name: mapPrerenderedFont
member.desc: Maps a pre-rendered font to the currently selected font name. From then on, the specified pre-rendered font will be used instead for fonts with the same settings. The setting becomes effective for all layers.

member.name: unmapPrerenderedFont
member.desc: Unmaps the pre-rendered font for the currently selected font name.

member.name: face
member.desc: Represents the font name. You can also set a value. Multiple candidates can be specified separated by commas. In this case, an actually existing font is used, with priority given to those listed first. Whether a font actually exists is determined by referring to the OS font list. If none of the candidates match, the default font is used (fixed to "MS PGothic" in the current version). If you start with a comma followed by a font name, it will attempt to specify that font to the OS even if the OS does not enumerate it (e.g., ",My Original Font"). This allows the use of non-enumerable fonts registered with the AddFontResource Win32 API, etc.

member.name: height
member.desc: Represents the height of the drawn characters in pixels. You can also set a value.

member.name: bold
member.desc: Indicates whether the font is bold. You can also set a value. If true is specified, it becomes bold.

member.name: italic
member.desc: Indicates whether the font is italic. You can also set a value. If true is specified, it becomes italic.

member.name: strikeout
member.desc: Indicates whether to draw a strikeout line. You can also set a value. If true is specified, a strikeout line is drawn over the characters.

member.name: underline
member.desc: Indicates whether to draw an underline. You can also set a value. If true is specified, an underline is drawn.

member.name: angle
member.desc: Represents the character drawing angle. You can also set a value. The unit is 10 times the value in degrees. It takes a value from 0 to 3600. When performing vertical writing, specify a vertical writing font name for the font name and set this property to 2700.

member.name: rasterizer
member.desc: Represents the string rendering method. You can also set a value. Specify one of the following values. frGDI : Draws characters using GDI frFreeType : Draws characters using FreeType If FreeType is specified, only horizontal writing is supported. Others are not supported. This property is static. Set the value using Font.rasterizer.
